title: Kalliculator & LivePen
content:
Has anyone tried Kalliculator [http://kalliculator.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211008/http:/kalliculator.com/) or LivePen [http://01-lab.com/livepen.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211008/http:/01-lab.com/livepen.html)?

I think this is a great idea, though by no means do I think they will be able to generate fully-formed quality typefaces. They do seem like a great tool for generating consistent contrasts and making it possible to test a typeface’s color at dozens of weights before committing to anything.

Has anyone had the chance to try them out? I’m on CS3, so I haven’t been able to try LivePen, and Kalliculator is yet to be released.

 [‹ Textbook design: dimensions](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211008/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41974 "Go to previous forum topic") [using graphology on typography ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211008/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41917 "Go to next forum topic")
author: FeeltheKern

comments.content: Frederik said that he’s working on the release of an opensource beta version, or something like that.

I have. See my comment here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/41766](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905211008/http:/typophile.com/node/41766 "http://typophile.com/node/41766")
Good info, Tim. It sounds like LivePen is somewhat lacking, but what’s your experience with Kalliculator? Thanks
